column14: Fresly collected human tumor samples were mechanically and enzymatically digested using tumor dissociation kit (Miltenyi Biotec). Single cells were sorted by flow cytometry
column15: lysed and snap frozen on dry ice immediately.
column16: RNA libraries were prepared using Smart-seq2 protocol (Picelli et al.
column19: Fastq files were quantified to transcript per million (TPM) expression values with RSEM with default parameters
column20: Low quality cells were filtered as follows: 4 median absolute deviations (MADs) below the median for any of the three metrics concering: i) library size; ii) number of expressed genes; iii) total amount of mRNA
column21: Unexpressed genes were removed as follows: a gene was considered unexpressed if log2(TPM+1) < 0.1 in at least 95% of cells separately for each patient
column22: Data was normalized following a three-step combination approach: i) Transform the TPM values into relative counts with the Census algorithm (Qiu et al
column23: 2017); ii) Normalize the Census counts with the deconvolution strategy implemented in scran (Lun et al 2016); iii) Remove additional sources of variation with RUVSeq (Risso et al
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tab-delimited text files representing: TPM values (tpm_rsem.txt); counts (counts_rsem.txt); normalized data as described above (norm_data.txt)

column20: Low quality cells were filtered as follows: 4 median absolute deviations (MADs) below the median for any of the three metrics concering: i) library size; ii) number of expressed genes; iii) total amount of mRNA
column21: Unexpressed genes were removed as follows: a gene was considered unexpressed if log2(TPM+1) < 0.1 in at least 95% of cells separately for each patient
column22: Data was normalized following a three-step combination approach: i) Transform the TPM values into relative counts with the Census algorithm (Qiu et al
column23: 2017); ii) Normalize the Census counts with the deconvolution strategy implemented in scran (Lun et al 2016); iii) Remove additional sources of variation with RUVSeq (Risso et al
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tab-delimited text files representing: TPM values (tpm_rsem.txt); counts (counts_rsem.txt); normalized data as described above (norm_data.txt)

column15: lysed and snap frozen on dry ice immediately.
column16: RNA libraries were prepared using Smart-seq2 protocol (Picelli et al.
column19: Fastq files were quantified to transcript per million (TPM) expression values with RSEM with default parameters
column20: Low quality cells were filtered as follows: 4 median absolute deviations (MADs) below the median for any of the three metrics concering: i) library size; ii) number of expressed genes; iii) total amount of mRNA
column21: Unexpressed genes were removed as follows: a gene was considered unexpressed if log2(TPM+1) < 0.1 in at least 95% of cells separately for each patient
column22: Data was normalized following a three-step combination approach: i) Transform the TPM values into relative counts with the Census algorithm (Qiu et al
column23: 2017); ii) Normalize the Census counts with the deconvolution strategy implemented in scran (Lun et al 2016); iii) Remove additional sources of variation with RUVSeq (Risso et al
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tab-delimited text files representing: TPM values (tpm_rsem.txt); counts (counts_rsem.txt); normalized data as described above (norm_data.txt)

column21: Unexpressed genes were removed as follows: a gene was considered unexpressed if log2(TPM+1) < 0.1 in at least 95% of cells separately for each patient
column22: Data was normalized following a three-step combination approach: i) Transform the TPM values into relative counts with the Census algorithm (Qiu et al
column23: 2017); ii) Normalize the Census counts with the deconvolution strategy implemented in scran (Lun et al 2016); iii) Remove additional sources of variation with RUVSeq (Risso et al

column19: Fastq files were quantified to transcript per million (TPM) expression values with RSEM with default parameters
column20: Low quality cells were filtered as follows: 4 median absolute deviations (MADs) below the median for any of the three metrics concering: i) library size; ii) number of expressed genes; iii) total amount of mRNA
column21: Unexpressed genes were removed as follows: a gene was considered unexpressed if log2(TPM+1) < 0.1 in at least 95% of cells separately for each patient
column22: Data was normalized following a three-step combination approach: i) Transform the TPM values into relative counts with the Census algorithm (Qiu et al
column23: 2017); ii) Normalize the Census counts with the deconvolution strategy implemented in scran (Lun et al 2016); iii) Remove additional sources of variation with RUVSeq (Risso et al

column15: lysed and snap frozen on dry ice immediately.
column16: RNA libraries were prepared using Smart-seq2 protocol (Picelli et al.
column19: Fastq files were quantified to transcript per million (TPM) expression values with RSEM with default parameters
column20: Low quality cells were filtered as follows: 4 median absolute deviations (MADs) below the median for any of the three metrics concering: i) library size; ii) number of expressed genes; iii) total amount of mRNA
column21: Unexpressed genes were removed as follows: a gene was considered unexpressed if log2(TPM+1) < 0.1 in at least 95% of cells separately for each patient
column22: Data was normalized following a three-step combination approach: i) Transform the TPM values into relative counts with the Census algorithm (Qiu et al
column23: 2017); ii) Normalize the Census counts with the deconvolution strategy implemented in scran (Lun et al 2016); iii) Remove additional sources of variation with RUVSeq (Risso et al
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tab-delimited text files representing: TPM values (tpm_rsem.txt); counts (counts_rsem.txt); normalized data as described above (norm_data.txt)

column21: Unexpressed genes were removed as follows: a gene was considered unexpressed if log2(TPM+1) < 0.1 in at least 95% of cells separately for each patient
column22: Data was normalized following a three-step combination approach: i) Transform the TPM values into relative counts with the Census algorithm (Qiu et al
column23: 2017); ii) Normalize the Census counts with the deconvolution strategy implemented in scran (Lun et al 2016); iii) Remove additional sources of variation with RUVSeq (Risso et al

column19: Fastq files were quantified to transcript per million (TPM) expression values with RSEM with default parameters
column20: Low quality cells were filtered as follows: 4 median absolute deviations (MADs) below the median for any of the three metrics concering: i) library size; ii) number of expressed genes; iii) total amount of mRNA
column21: Unexpressed genes were removed as follows: a gene was considered unexpressed if log2(TPM+1) < 0.1 in at least 95% of cells separately for each patient
column22: Data was normalized following a three-step combination approach: i) Transform the TPM values into relative counts with the Census algorithm (Qiu et al
column23: 2017); ii) Normalize the Census counts with the deconvolution strategy implemented in scran (Lun et al 2016); iii) Remove additional sources of variation with RUVSeq (Risso et al

column15: lysed and snap frozen on dry ice immediately.
column16: RNA libraries were prepared using Smart-seq2 protocol (Picelli et al.
column19: Fastq files were quantified to transcript per million (TPM) expression values with RSEM with default parameters
column20: Low quality cells were filtered as follows: 4 median absolute deviations (MADs) below the median for any of the three metrics concering: i) library size; ii) number of expressed genes; iii) total amount of mRNA
column21: Unexpressed genes were removed as follows: a gene was considered unexpressed if log2(TPM+1) < 0.1 in at least 95% of cells separately for each patient
column22: Data was normalized following a three-step combination approach: i) Transform the TPM values into relative counts with the Census algorithm (Qiu et al
column23: 2017); ii) Normalize the Census counts with the deconvolution strategy implemented in scran (Lun et al 2016); iii) Remove additional sources of variation with RUVSeq (Risso et al
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tab-delimited text files representing: TPM values (tpm_rsem.txt); counts (counts_rsem.txt); normalized data as described above (norm_data.txt)

column21: Unexpressed genes were removed as follows: a gene was considered unexpressed if log2(TPM+1) < 0.1 in at least 95% of cells separately for each patient
column22: Data was normalized following a three-step combination approach: i) Transform the TPM values into relative counts with the Census algorithm (Qiu et al
column23: 2017); ii) Normalize the Census counts with the deconvolution strategy implemented in scran (Lun et al 2016); iii) Remove additional sources of variation with RUVSeq (Risso et al

column19: Fastq files were quantified to transcript per million (TPM) expression values with RSEM with default parameters
column20: Low quality cells were filtered as follows: 4 median absolute deviations (MADs) below the median for any of the three metrics concering: i) library size; ii) number of expressed genes; iii) total amount of mRNA
column21: Unexpressed genes were removed as follows: a gene was considered unexpressed if log2(TPM+1) < 0.1 in at least 95% of cells separately for each patient
column22: Data was normalized following a three-step combination approach: i) Transform the TPM values into relative counts with the Census algorithm (Qiu et al
column23: 2017); ii) Normalize the Census counts with the deconvolution strategy implemented in scran (Lun et al 2016); iii) Remove additional sources of variation with RUVSeq (Risso et al

column15: lysed and snap frozen on dry ice immediately.
column16: RNA libraries were prepared using Smart-seq2 protocol (Picelli et al.
column19: Fastq files were quantified to transcript per million (TPM) expression values with RSEM with default parameters
column20: Low quality cells were filtered as follows: 4 median absolute deviations (MADs) below the median for any of the three metrics concering: i) library size; ii) number of expressed genes; iii) total amount of mRNA
column21: Unexpressed genes were removed as follows: a gene was considered unexpressed if log2(TPM+1) < 0.1 in at least 95% of cells separately for each patient
column22: Data was normalized following a three-step combination approach: i) Transform the TPM values into relative counts with the Census algorithm (Qiu et al
column23: 2017); ii) Normalize the Census counts with the deconvolution strategy implemented in scran (Lun et al 2016); iii) Remove additional sources of variation with RUVSeq (Risso et al
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tab-delimited text files representing: TPM values (tpm_rsem.txt); counts (counts_rsem.txt); normalized data as described above (norm_data.txt)

column21: Unexpressed genes were removed as follows: a gene was considered unexpressed if log2(TPM+1) < 0.1 in at least 95% of cells separately for each patient
column22: Data was normalized following a three-step combination approach: i) Transform the TPM values into relative counts with the Census algorithm (Qiu et al
column23: 2017); ii) Normalize the Census counts with the deconvolution strategy implemented in scran (Lun et al 2016); iii) Remove additional sources of variation with RUVSeq (Risso et al

column19: Fastq files were quantified to transcript per million (TPM) expression values with RSEM with default parameters
column20: Low quality cells were filtered as follows: 4 median absolute deviations (MADs) below the median for any of the three metrics concering: i) library size; ii) number of expressed genes; iii) total amount of mRNA
column21: Unexpressed genes were removed as follows: a gene was considered unexpressed if log2(TPM+1) < 0.1 in at least 95% of cells separately for each patient
column22: Data was normalized following a three-step combination approach: i) Transform the TPM values into relative counts with the Census algorithm (Qiu et al
column23: 2017); ii) Normalize the Census counts with the deconvolution strategy implemented in scran (Lun et al 2016); iii) Remove additional sources of variation with RUVSeq (Risso et al

column15: lysed and snap frozen on dry ice immediately.
column16: RNA libraries were prepared using Smart-seq2 protocol (Picelli et al.
column19: Fastq files were quantified to transcript per million (TPM) expression values with RSEM with default parameters
column20: Low quality cells were filtered as follows: 4 median absolute deviations (MADs) below the median for any of the three metrics concering: i) library size; ii) number of expressed genes; iii) total amount of mRNA
column21: Unexpressed genes were removed as follows: a gene was considered unexpressed if log2(TPM+1) < 0.1 in at least 95% of cells separately for each patient
column22: Data was normalized following a three-step combination approach: i) Transform the TPM values into relative counts with the Census algorithm (Qiu et al
column23: 2017); ii) Normalize the Census counts with the deconvolution strategy implemented in scran (Lun et al 2016); iii) Remove additional sources of variation with RUVSeq (Risso et al
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tab-delimited text files representing: TPM values (tpm_rsem.txt); counts (counts_rsem.txt); normalized data as described above (norm_data.txt)

column21: Unexpressed genes were removed as follows: a gene was considered unexpressed if log2(TPM+1) < 0.1 in at least 95% of cells separately for each patient
column22: Data was normalized following a three-step combination approach: i) Transform the TPM values into relative counts with the Census algorithm (Qiu et al
column23: 2017); ii) Normalize the Census counts with the deconvolution strategy implemented in scran (Lun et al 2016); iii) Remove additional sources of variation with RUVSeq (Risso et al

column19: Fastq files were quantified to transcript per million (TPM) expression values with RSEM with default parameters
column20: Low quality cells were filtered as follows: 4 median absolute deviations (MADs) below the median for any of the three metrics concering: i) library size; ii) number of expressed genes; iii) total amount of mRNA
column21: Unexpressed genes were removed as follows: a gene was considered unexpressed if log2(TPM+1) < 0.1 in at least 95% of cells separately for each patient
column22: Data was normalized following a three-step combination approach: i) Transform the TPM values into relative counts with the Census algorithm (Qiu et al
column23: 2017); ii) Normalize the Census counts with the deconvolution strategy implemented in scran (Lun et al 2016); iii) Remove additional sources of variation with RUVSeq (Risso et al

column15: lysed and snap frozen on dry ice immediately.
column16: RNA libraries were prepared using Smart-seq2 protocol (Picelli et al.
column19: Fastq files were quantified to transcript per million (TPM) expression values with RSEM with default parameters
column20: Low quality cells were filtered as follows: 4 median absolute deviations (MADs) below the median for any of the three metrics concering: i) library size; ii) number of expressed genes; iii) total amount of mRNA
column21: Unexpressed genes were removed as follows: a gene was considered unexpressed if log2(TPM+1) < 0.1 in at least 95% of cells separately for each patient
column22: Data was normalized following a three-step combination approach: i) Transform the TPM values into relative counts with the Census algorithm (Qiu et al
column23: 2017); ii) Normalize the Census counts with the deconvolution strategy implemented in scran (Lun et al 2016); iii) Remove additional sources of variation with RUVSeq (Risso et al
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tab-delimited text files representing: TPM values (tpm_rsem.txt); counts (counts_rsem.txt); normalized data as described above (norm_data.txt)

column21: Unexpressed genes were removed as follows: a gene was considered unexpressed if log2(TPM+1) < 0.1 in at least 95% of cells separately for each patient
column22: Data was normalized following a three-step combination approach: i) Transform the TPM values into relative counts with the Census algorithm (Qiu et al
column23: 2017); ii) Normalize the Census counts with the deconvolution strategy implemented in scran (Lun et al 2016); iii) Remove additional sources of variation with RUVSeq (Risso et al

column19: Fastq files were quantified to transcript per million (TPM) expression values with RSEM with default parameters
column20: Low quality cells were filtered as follows: 4 median absolute deviations (MADs) below the median for any of the three metrics concering: i) library size; ii) number of expressed genes; iii) total amount of mRNA
column21: Unexpressed genes were removed as follows: a gene was considered unexpressed if log2(TPM+1) < 0.1 in at least 95% of cells separately for each patient
column22: Data was normalized following a three-step combination approach: i) Transform the TPM values into relative counts with the Census algorithm (Qiu et al
column23: 2017); ii) Normalize the Census counts with the deconvolution strategy implemented in scran (Lun et al 2016); iii) Remove additional sources of variation with RUVSeq (Risso et al

column15: lysed and snap frozen on dry ice immediately.
column16: RNA libraries were prepared using Smart-seq2 protocol (Picelli et al.
column19: Fastq files were quantified to transcript per million (TPM) expression values with RSEM with default parameters
column20: Low quality cells were filtered as follows: 4 median absolute deviations (MADs) below the median for any of the three metrics concering: i) library size; ii) number of expressed genes; iii) total amount of mRNA
column21: Unexpressed genes were removed as follows: a gene was considered unexpressed if log2(TPM+1) < 0.1 in at least 95% of cells separately for each patient
column22: Data was normalized following a three-step combination approach: i) Transform the TPM values into relative counts with the Census algorithm (Qiu et al
column23: 2017); ii) Normalize the Census counts with the deconvolution strategy implemented in scran (Lun et al 2016); iii) Remove additional sources of variation with RUVSeq (Risso et al
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tab-delimited text files representing: TPM values (tpm_rsem.txt); counts (counts_rsem.txt); normalized data as described above (norm_data.txt)

column21: Unexpressed genes were removed as follows: a gene was considered unexpressed if log2(TPM+1) < 0.1 in at least 95% of cells separately for each patient
column22: Data was normalized following a three-step combination approach: i) Transform the TPM values into relative counts with the Census algorithm (Qiu et al
column23: 2017); ii) Normalize the Census counts with the deconvolution strategy implemented in scran (Lun et al 2016); iii) Remove additional sources of variation with RUVSeq (Risso et al

column19: Fastq files were quantified to transcript per million (TPM) expression values with RSEM with default parameters
column20: Low quality cells were filtered as follows: 4 median absolute deviations (MADs) below the median for any of the three metrics concering: i) library size; ii) number of expressed genes; iii) total amount of mRNA
column21: Unexpressed genes were removed as follows: a gene was considered unexpressed if log2(TPM+1) < 0.1 in at least 95% of cells separately for each patient
column22: Data was normalized following a three-step combination approach: i) Transform the TPM values into relative counts with the Census algorithm (Qiu et al
column23: 2017); ii) Normalize the Census counts with the deconvolution strategy implemented in scran (Lun et al 2016); iii) Remove additional sources of variation with RUVSeq (Risso et al

column15: lysed and snap frozen on dry ice immediately.
column16: RNA libraries were prepared using Smart-seq2 protocol (Picelli et al.
column19: Fastq files were quantified to transcript per million (TPM) expression values with RSEM with default parameters
column20: Low quality cells were filtered as follows: 4 median absolute deviations (MADs) below the median for any of the three metrics concering: i) library size; ii) number of expressed genes; iii) total amount of mRNA
column21: Unexpressed genes were removed as follows: a gene was considered unexpressed if log2(TPM+1) < 0.1 in at least 95% of cells separately for each patient
column22: Data was normalized following a three-step combination approach: i) Transform the TPM values into relative counts with the Census algorithm (Qiu et al
column23: 2017); ii) Normalize the Census counts with the deconvolution strategy implemented in scran (Lun et al 2016); iii) Remove additional sources of variation with RUVSeq (Risso et al
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tab-delimited text files representing: TPM values (tpm_rsem.txt); counts (counts_rsem.txt); normalized data as described above (norm_data.txt)

column21: Unexpressed genes were removed as follows: a gene was considered unexpressed if log2(TPM+1) < 0.1 in at least 95% of cells separately for each patient
column22: Data was normalized following a three-step combination approach: i) Transform the TPM values into relative counts with the Census algorithm (Qiu et al
column23: 2017); ii) Normalize the Census counts with the deconvolution strategy implemented in scran (Lun et al 2016); iii) Remove additional sources of variation with RUVSeq (Risso et al

column19: Fastq files were quantified to transcript per million (TPM) expression values with RSEM with default parameters
column20: Low quality cells were filtered as follows: 4 median absolute deviations (MADs) below the median for any of the three metrics concering: i) library size; ii) number of expressed genes; iii) total amount of mRNA
column21: Unexpressed genes were removed as follows: a gene was considered unexpressed if log2(TPM+1) < 0.1 in at least 95% of cells separately for each patient
column22: Data was normalized following a three-step combination approach: i) Transform the TPM values into relative counts with the Census algorithm (Qiu et al
column23: 2017); ii) Normalize the Census counts with the deconvolution strategy implemented in scran (Lun et al 2016); iii) Remove additional sources of variation with RUVSeq (Risso et al

column15: lysed and snap frozen on dry ice immediately.
column16: RNA libraries were prepared using Smart-seq2 protocol (Picelli et al.
column19: Fastq files were quantified to transcript per million (TPM) expression values with RSEM with default parameters
column20: Low quality cells were filtered as follows: 4 median absolute deviations (MADs) below the median for any of the three metrics concering: i) library size; ii) number of expressed genes; iii) total amount of mRNA
column21: Unexpressed genes were removed as follows: a gene was considered unexpressed if log2(TPM+1) < 0.1 in at least 95% of cells separately for each patient
column22: Data was normalized following a three-step combination approach: i) Transform the TPM values into relative counts with the Census algorithm (Qiu et al
column23: 2017); ii) Normalize the Census counts with the deconvolution strategy implemented in scran (Lun et al 2016); iii) Remove additional sources of variation with RUVSeq (Risso et al
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tab-delimited text files representing: TPM values (tpm_rsem.txt); counts (counts_rsem.txt); normalized data as described above (norm_data.txt)

column21: Unexpressed genes were removed as follows: a gene was considered unexpressed if log2(TPM+1) < 0.1 in at least 95% of cells separately for each patient
column22: Data was normalized following a three-step combination approach: i) Transform the TPM values into relative counts with the Census algorithm (Qiu et al
column23: 2017); ii) Normalize the Census counts with the deconvolution strategy implemented in scran (Lun et al 2016); iii) Remove additional sources of variation with RUVSeq (Risso et al

column19: Fastq files were quantified to transcript per million (TPM) expression values with RSEM with default parameters
column20: Low quality cells were filtered as follows: 4 median absolute deviations (MADs) below the median for any of the three metrics concering: i) library size; ii) number of expressed genes; iii) total amount of mRNA
column21: Unexpressed genes were removed as follows: a gene was considered unexpressed if log2(TPM+1) < 0.1 in at least 95% of cells separately for each patient
column22: Data was normalized following a three-step combination approach: i) Transform the TPM values into relative counts with the Census algorithm (Qiu et al
column23: 2017); ii) Normalize the Census counts with the deconvolution strategy implemented in scran (Lun et al 2016); iii) Remove additional sources of variation with RUVSeq (Risso et al

column15: lysed and snap frozen on dry ice immediately.
column16: RNA libraries were prepared using Smart-seq2 protocol (Picelli et al.
column19: Fastq files were quantified to transcript per million (TPM) expression values with RSEM with default parameters
column20: Low quality cells were filtered as follows: 4 median absolute deviations (MADs) below the median for any of the three metrics concering: i) library size; ii) number of expressed genes; iii) total amount of mRNA
column21: Unexpressed genes were removed as follows: a gene was considered unexpressed if log2(TPM+1) < 0.1 in at least 95% of cells separately for each patient
column22: Data was normalized following a three-step combination approach: i) Transform the TPM values into relative counts with the Census algorithm (Qiu et al
column23: 2017); ii) Normalize the Census counts with the deconvolution strategy implemented in scran (Lun et al 2016); iii) Remove additional sources of variation with RUVSeq (Risso et al
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tab-delimited text files representing: TPM values (tpm_rsem.txt); counts (counts_rsem.txt); normalized data as described above (norm_data.txt)

column21: Unexpressed genes were removed as follows: a gene was considered unexpressed if log2(TPM+1) < 0.1 in at least 95% of cells separately for each patient
column22: Data was normalized following a three-step combination approach: i) Transform the TPM values into relative counts with the Census algorithm (Qiu et al
column23: 2017); ii) Normalize the Census counts with the deconvolution strategy implemented in scran (Lun et al 2016); iii) Remove additional sources of variation with RUVSeq (Risso et al

column19: Fastq files were quantified to transcript per million (TPM) expression values with RSEM with default parameters
column20: Low quality cells were filtered as follows: 4 median absolute deviations (MADs) below the median for any of the three metrics concering: i) library size; ii) number of expressed genes; iii) total amount of mRNA
column21: Unexpressed genes were removed as follows: a gene was considered unexpressed if log2(TPM+1) < 0.1 in at least 95% of cells separately for each patient
column22: Data was normalized following a three-step combination approach: i) Transform the TPM values into relative counts with the Census algorithm (Qiu et al
column23: 2017); ii) Normalize the Census counts with the deconvolution strategy implemented in scran (Lun et al 2016); iii) Remove additional sources of variation with RUVSeq (Risso et al

column15: lysed and snap frozen on dry ice immediately.
column16: RNA libraries were prepared using Smart-seq2 protocol (Picelli et al.
column19: Fastq files were quantified to transcript per million (TPM) expression values with RSEM with default parameters
column20: Low quality cells were filtered as follows: 4 median absolute deviations (MADs) below the median for any of the three metrics concering: i) library size; ii) number of expressed genes; iii) total amount of mRNA
column21: Unexpressed genes were removed as follows: a gene was considered unexpressed if log2(TPM+1) < 0.1 in at least 95% of cells separately for each patient
column22: Data was normalized following a three-step combination approach: i) Transform the TPM values into relative counts with the Census algorithm (Qiu et al
column23: 2017); ii) Normalize the Census counts with the deconvolution strategy implemented in scran (Lun et al 2016); iii) Remove additional sources of variation with RUVSeq (Risso et al
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tab-delimited text files representing: TPM values (tpm_rsem.txt); counts (counts_rsem.txt); normalized data as described above (norm_data.txt)

column21: Unexpressed genes were removed as follows: a gene was considered unexpressed if log2(TPM+1) < 0.1 in at least 95% of cells separately for each patient
column22: Data was normalized following a three-step combination approach: i) Transform the TPM values into relative counts with the Census algorithm (Qiu et al
column23: 2017); ii) Normalize the Census counts with the deconvolution strategy implemented in scran (Lun et al 2016); iii) Remove additional sources of variation with RUVSeq (Risso et al

column19: Fastq files were quantified to transcript per million (TPM) expression values with RSEM with default parameters
column20: Low quality cells were filtered as follows: 4 median absolute deviations (MADs) below the median for any of the three metrics concering: i) library size; ii) number of expressed genes; iii) total amount of mRNA
column21: Unexpressed genes were removed as follows: a gene was considered unexpressed if log2(TPM+1) < 0.1 in at least 95% of cells separately for each patient
column22: Data was normalized following a three-step combination approach: i) Transform the TPM values into relative counts with the Census algorithm (Qiu et al
column23: 2017); ii) Normalize the Census counts with the deconvolution strategy implemented in scran (Lun et al 2016); iii) Remove additional sources of variation with RUVSeq (Risso et al

column15: lysed and snap frozen on dry ice immediately.
column16: RNA libraries were prepared using Smart-seq2 protocol (Picelli et al.
column19: Fastq files were quantified to transcript per million (TPM) expression values with RSEM with default parameters
column20: Low quality cells were filtered as follows: 4 median absolute deviations (MADs) below the median for any of the three metrics concering: i) library size; ii) number of expressed genes; iii) total amount of mRNA
column21: Unexpressed genes were removed as follows: a gene was considered unexpressed if log2(TPM+1) < 0.1 in at least 95% of cells separately for each patient
column22: Data was normalized following a three-step combination approach: i) Transform the TPM values into relative counts with the Census algorithm (Qiu et al
column23: 2017); ii) Normalize the Census counts with the deconvolution strategy implemented in scran (Lun et al 2016); iii) Remove additional sources of variation with RUVSeq (Risso et al
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tab-delimited text files representing: TPM values (tpm_rsem.txt); counts (counts_rsem.txt); normalized data as described above (norm_data.txt)

column21: Unexpressed genes were removed as follows: a gene was considered unexpressed if log2(TPM+1) < 0.1 in at least 95% of cells separately for each patient
column22: Data was normalized following a three-step combination approach: i) Transform the TPM values into relative counts with the Census algorithm (Qiu et al
column23: 2017); ii) Normalize the Census counts with the deconvolution strategy implemented in scran (Lun et al 2016); iii) Remove additional sources of variation with RUVSeq (Risso et al

column19: Fastq files were quantified to transcript per million (TPM) expression values with RSEM with default parameters
column20: Low quality cells were filtered as follows: 4 median absolute deviations (MADs) below the median for any of the three metrics concering: i) library size; ii) number of expressed genes; iii) total amount of mRNA
column21: Unexpressed genes were removed as follows: a gene was considered unexpressed if log2(TPM+1) < 0.1 in at least 95% of cells separately for each patient
column22: Data was normalized following a three-step combination approach: i) Transform the TPM values into relative counts with the Census algorithm (Qiu et al
column23: 2017); ii) Normalize the Census counts with the deconvolution strategy implemented in scran (Lun et al 2016); iii) Remove additional sources of variation with RUVSeq (Risso et al
